info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 11 at 8:58AM EST until January 12 at 12:03PM EST by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Virginia...North Carolina... Roanoke (Staunton) River at Randolph affecting Halifax and Charlotte Counties. Dan River at Dan River at Paces affecting Halifax County. Dan River at South Boston affecting Halifax County. Dan River near Danville affecting Pittsylvania, City of Danville, Caswell and Rockingham independent cities. .Very heavy rain fell across the region Tuesday into early Wednesday. Excessive runoff into the lower portion of the Dan and the Roanoke River basins continues and will for another day or two in most cases. For the Roanoke River...including Randolph...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Dan River...including South Boston, Dan River at Paces, STP near Danville...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY FRIDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast to continue until Friday afternoon. At 800 AM EST this morning, the stage was 27.6 ft. Flood stage is 24.0 feet. * WHERE...Roanoke (Staunton) River at Randolph. * WHEN...Until early tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 25.0 feet, Water is several feet deep on portions of River Road and Black Walnut Road. At 30.0 feet, Water starts to reach base of Randolph Post Office. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:00 AM EST this morning, the stage was 27.6 feet and slowly falling. - Bankfull stage is 21.0 feet. Flood stage is 24.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 7:45 AM EST Thursday was 27.6 feet. - Forecast...The river is cresting and has begun a slow fall. - Flood stage is 24.0 feet. - For additional information please visit our web site at http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Minor flooding is occurring and will continue along the lower portion of the Dan and Roanoke rivers. Most flood related deaths occur in automobiles. Do not attempt to cross water covered bridges, dips, or low water crossings. Never try to cross a flowing stream, even a small one, on foot. To escape rising water find another route over higher ground. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. For additional information please visit our web site at www.weather.gov/blacksburg. this afternoon at 200 PM EST.
